result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian D Schram was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court will allow for transfer to any other county.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the victims (Subway on Main Street, Discount Liquor or the apartment complex on Corena Blvd).
No contact with any of the witnesses listed in the criminal complaints (Cases 15CM1562 and 15CM1527).
Defendant to contact DOC by 09:00 a.m. on 09-24-2015.
Case 15CM1528 is dismissed and read in.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) - with all standard release conditions.
STAYED.  To be used at Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian D Schram

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Response letter from Court denying defendant's request for huber privilges.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian D Schram
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 02-18-2016)
Prior: 12323 W Woodland Ave, Wauwatosa, WI 53226

filed by defendant requesting huber for release for AODA and mental health treatment.

2/15/16 - Court denied defendant's request for huber privileges.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Court approves order of imposition of the stayed 30 days condition time, with Huber release for employment AND treatment.
filed by Dept. of Corrections requesting the Court impose the stayed 30 days jail with huber.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Brian D Schram in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Counts 1 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.


Court orders the following:
150 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  12 Months
Court will allow for transfer to anyother county.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victims (Subway Main Street, Discount Liquor or Apartment Complex on Corena Blvd.) or witnesses listed in the criminal complaints on 15CM1562 and 15CM1527.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Defendant to contact DOC by 9:00 am. tomorrow 09/24/15.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


CONDITION TIME: 
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.

Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Brian D Schram in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Atty. Adam Schleis has been appointed to represent the defendant.

Defendant to have no contact with witnessesor the apartment listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol or any food product that contains alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Brian D Schram in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
